relation: Scholarship
Alumni Legacy Resident Scholarship
Alumni Legacy Nonresident Waiver
USU Emeriti Sophomore Scholarship
SAE Legacy Scholarship
Chi Omega Legacy Scholarship
J. Arza Adams Scholarship
Nadine F. Gillmor Scholarship
Reuben & Della Ward Scholarship
University Advancement & Commercialization Outreach and Engagement Scholarship
Description
Available to incoming students whose parent or grandparent attended Utah State University.
Available to nonresident students whose parent or grandparent earned a degree from Utah State University. Deadline to apply, August 1.
Available to USU students who have achieved sophomore status and meet application requirements.
Available to students whose parent or grandparent who were an active member of the Phi Kappa Iota / Sigma Alpha Epsilon fraternity.
Available to students whose parent, grandparent, brother, or sister were active members of the Alpha Gamma Chapter of Chi Omega.
Available to students from Pleasant Grove High School (Utah) who demonstrates academic achievement, leadership, and financial need.
Available to students enrolled in the Summit County 4-H program who demonstrates academic achievement, leadership, and financial need.
Available to students who attend Raft River or Declo High School (Idaho).
Available to all students wishing to acquire university administrative experience by engaging with alumni and corporations.
textBeforeTable: The following is a list of available scholarships. Applications, requirements, and deadlines for each scholarship vary. More information is available by clicking the link. Note: all the scholarships listed below (with the exception of the Alumni Legacy Nonresident Waiver) cannot be held or deferred. As Alumni Scholarships are 1 year awards, they must be used in the year they are awarded. Utah State University offers a variety of alumni scholarships. These scholarships are in place to assist the children and grandchildren of alumni who want to continue the legacy at Utah State. Funds for the scholarships are raised in a variety of ways, including private donations, earnings from endowments, and the Aggie License Plate program.
